title: new runes give even less variety then the game had before.
body:
this new system is fucking so stupid..... i just played a game as thresh and started out with 29 armour..... 29 armour on someone whos supposed to engage early to get ahead but i was squishier then sona.

season 9 rolls round.... " so youve gotten used to the crappy runes we threw at you, so now were going to change it yet again."

ive never seen a game that just aims to piss people off by fucking changing everything constantly on a regular basis.

do i lterally have to play whats fotm strong every game now? why even a 140 champion pool if about 75% of them rarely get played outside of aram.

replies.body:
The new runes annoy me because it's just another example of the strong getting stronger.

Champs like Vayne or Xin who are already strong, get to use pretty much any rune they want because they are nearly all OP on them, meanwhile champs like Ivern are stuck without any effective runes at all..

They are also so snowbally, so as soon as you get ahead, RIP the other team! and vice versa.

Ivern is the only champ I've seen struggling with the new system, and I am more than okay with this.
He should never have been created in the first place, and caused the downfall of the jungle for the entirety of Season 7.

Jungle camp exp and gold rates were nerfed, to accommodate this support who's pretending to be a jungler.
A "jungler" who ignores the jungle items, and builds purely support items, has an ultimate pet overloaded with CC and unlike say Tibers or the Mist Lady doesn't require Ivern to buy any actual stats to scale with.

In high elo it was effectively Ivern or Graves if you wanted to win as a jungler, even the holy trinity struggled.

Now the jungle camps exp and gold rates are back within a reasonable level and we have diversity again!

I like the intent of combining the two. It is removing a layer of complexity that was a big turnoff and people were heading to hots because they could get started faster.

But it sounds like they need some tweaking.

I mean sure, remove complexity all you want, but don't then go saying "oh there is more options" when there flat out isn't.

These runes don't give real choice.

>
> I mean sure, remove complexity all you want, but don't then go saying "oh there is more options" when there flat out isn't.
> 
> These runes don't give real choice.

I think it is a move to combat the players being lost to HotS who are turned off by the complexity of runes and masteries.
They just need to increase the base armor and magic resist on every non-tank champion more

I was saying when they came out that it's the same shit, there is no choice, you will get min-maxed.

Nearly every set of 3 choices, there is only 2 real choices, and they are made by your champion, rather then by you.
